data.title: Images by SirSchebling
data.meta_description:
#warthunder #live_wt #workshop

Bolkhovitinov S
In 1936 Soviet designer Victor Bolkhovitinov worked on combining the aerodynamic advantages of a single engine aircraft with the power a twin engined one. The result of this effort was the Sparka (twin), an all-metal monoplane shaped like a dagger. The entire plane looked very stretched and had a long greenhouse canopy and a twin-fin tail assembly. It had its two M-103 inline engine mounted behind each other, which saved a lot of drag but also made the nose very long.
